item.description: stephane.delbruel @ kuleuven.be +3216374538 Dpt Computer Science, KU Leuven

A Distributed Federation for LoRaWAN : FLIP This work aims to propose a collaborative platform for LoRaWAN actors. Backward compatibility with any deployed Class A end-device Free roaming inside the federation Cheap entry price: 1 Raspberry Pi Participating clusters in various European cities More resources in the official repository: here.

Journals Simplifying CPS Application Development through Fine-grained, Automatic Timeout Predictions with Stefanos Peros, Sam Michiels, Wouter Joosen and Danny Hughes at ACM Transactions on Internet of Things [submitted] Chimera: A low-power reconfigurable platform for Internet of Things with Emekcan Aras, Fan Yang, Wouter Joosen and Danny Hughes at ACM Transactions on Internet of Things Conferences Tackling Contention Through Cooperation: A Distributed Federation in LoRaWAN Space with Nicolas Small, Emekcan Aras, Jonathan Oostvogels and Danny Hughes at International Conference on Embedded Wireless Systems and Networks (EWSN 2020) pdf

Academic Service I’m actually involved in the co-organization of the 5th ASF GDR Winter school in distributed systems as well as serving as co-chair on the M4IoT workshop (2019,2018,2017) collocated with ACM/IFIP/USENIX Middleware conference. I also served in the Technical Program Committee for DFSD (2020, 2019) as well as Shadow PC member for Eurosys (2019, 2018). I’ve been a visiting researcher at Università della Svizzera Italiana in Switzerland during summer 2016 under the supervision of Pr.

item.title: Last Event
item.description: Our latest article Simplifying CPS Application Development through Fine-grained, Automatic Timeout Predictions will appear in the upcoming issue of ACM Transactions on Internet of Things !
